details.overview: Mature students can go to university and get funding - even if they don’t have traditional qualifications
details.body:
You can study at university as a mature student even if you don’t have traditional qualifications – you can also apply for funding.

Entry requirements

Course entry requirements vary - check with the university or college. Some universities will accept professional qualifications or relevant work experience. Others may need one of the following qualifications:

  • A levels
  • an Access to Higher Education course
  • NVQs, BTEC or other work-based qualifications

You don’t need qualifications to study at the Open University (OU) – it’s open to everyone.

Full-time courses

You can search and apply for full-time courses through UCAS.

Part-time courses

Search for part-time and Access courses through the National Careers Service.

Apply direct to the university or college - see a list of universities and colleges on UCAS.

Open University (OU) courses

You can search and apply for courses directly through the OU.

Compare courses

Unistats allows you to compare universities and courses to find the one that’s right for you.

Apply for student finance

You may be able to apply for student finance. The amount you get depends on your family situation and the type of course you’re doing - you may get extra help if you have children.
